alert.note: Alert for Amelia; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward; Western Chesterfield (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Chesterfield, east central Prince Edward, northern Nottoway, Amelia and southern Powhatan Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 357 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Sunnyside to near Rice. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Morven around 405 PM EDT. Crewe around 410 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse and Jetersville around 415 PM EDT. Chula around 420 PM EDT. Scotts Fork and Spainville around 430 PM EDT. Moseley and Mannboro around 435 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Flat Rock, Winterpock, Earls, Ammon, Pilkinton, Rodophil, Burkes Tavern, Midlothian, Moran and Giles Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects.

area.areaDesc: Amelia; Nottoway; Powhatan; Prince Edward; Western Chesterfield
